column4: I have 3443 lines of this: 3443 99.249.167.138 Unnamed NO Canada Rogers Cable
and all I want isthe IP
how would I go about extracting that?
it returns a bunch of blank lines.
that doesn't remove lines that contain both alphabets and numbers and more than one fullstop/period tho
if you want to be strict about those conditions. perl -i.bak -pe 'undef $_ unless /^(?:\d+|\.)$/'
I want to keep lines that have only numbers and periods.
I havent tested that out, but that should keep lines that have numbers and periods, everything else is junked
now I have a bunch of numbers like this, {1,3}.{1,3}.{1,3}.{1,3}<new line>{1,5}<new line>{1,4}            and I need   {1,3}.{1,3}.{1,3}.{1,3}:{1,5}
